key_events.description: POMO3 increased from R$5.55 to R$6.15 in 2026.
Dividend and JCP payments occurred throughout 2025 with 'data com' dates in November, August, April, and February.
Nord Investimentos recommends buying POMO3, highlighting high dividends and cheap shares.
Q3 2025 results missed expectations, with LPA at 0.2689 (-6.57%) and revenue at 2.51 billion BRL (-4.92%). Shares fell 6.46% to BRL 8.25 following the release.
A 10% stock bonus was approved by the Board of Directors, with a cost per share of R$6.21.

risk_factors: Potential volatility in share price following Q3 2025 results.
Dependence on sector recovery for maintaining high dividend yield.

investment_thesis.bull_case: High dividend yield (around 20%) and cheap shares, as highlighted by Nord Investimentos, present an attractive investment opportunity. The company recorded the highest bus production volume in the last ten years in 2024 (27,100 units).
investment_thesis.bear_case: Q3 2025 results missed expectations, leading to a share price decline. The company's dividend yield may return to a normal level of around 9% in 2026, according to Nord Investimentos, reducing its attractiveness to income-seeking investors.

summary_markdown: POMO3 experienced a price increase in 2026, starting at R$5.55 and reaching R$6.15. Dividend payments occurred throughout 2025. Nord Investimentos recommends buying POMO3, expecting a dividend yield around 9% in 2026, while the current year saw yields over 20%. A 10% stock bonus was approved. Q3 2025 results disappointed, with LPA at 0.2689 (-6.57%) and revenue at 2.51 billion BRL (-4.92%), causing shares to fall 6.46% to BRL 8.25. BB Investimentos added Marcopolo (POMO4) to its recommended stock portfolio for January. 2024 recorded the highest bus production volume in the last ten years, with 27,100 units. Next balance release date is February 25, 2026, with Q4 2025 results disclosed on February 26, 2026.
